channel.title: Help changing Client IP from PK Planet

item.title: Help changing Client IP from PK Planet
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Look in client.java and you need to search for where the server address is held. It may not necessarily be “localhost” or “127.0.0.1”.

The best way to find the name of the variable holding the server ip is to search for the method “Socket openSocket”

public Socket openSocket(int port) throws IOException { return new Socket(InetAddress.getByName([b]serverip[/b]), port); }

You’ll see something like this, and the name in brackets is the variable you’re looking for.

        public static String defaultServerIP = "0.0.0.0";        
        public static String defaultServerIPw2 = "0.0.0.0";
        //END OF IP'S
        public static String serverip = ""+defaultServerIP+"";

whala

Read full topic
item.source: Help changing Client IP from PK Planet

item.title: Help changing Client IP from PK Planet
item.dc:creator: @facundo facundo
item.description:
@facundo wrote:

Hi guys, as the title says, I can’t change the Client IP from my Pk Planet Client.

I looked for “127.0.0.1” and it didn’t find anything, then I looked for “localhost” at both client.java and gui.java, all I found was this:

  anInt957 = 10; //high detial //1?
        anInt958 = 0;
       // method52(false); //false
        aBoolean959 = true;
   
        signlink.storeid = 32; //not really needed for us
        signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());      
        method2(503, false, 765); //sets gameframe size
    }
    catch(Exception exception)

anInt957 = 10;
anInt958 = 0;
aBoolean959 = true;

         try {
           signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());
                }
      catch(UnknownHostException uhe) {

There is NO server.java file in the client.

What should I do to change the client ip?

Thanks for the help.

Read full topic
